content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(str::AbstractString; text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = Vector{String}()
    for word in split(str)
        if length(word) + sum(length, lines) > text_width
            push!(lines, "")
        end
        push!(lines, word)
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
str = "This is a very long string that needs to be wrapped into multiple lines."
wrap_string(str)  # Output will have line breaks inserted where necessary
```
